author: benzvibenjamin
title: United Caricature 2
description: There is not enough creative ways that connect between chains and unite them to grow mass adoption

f6_assessments.q0:
This is almost an exact replica of the original idea of using caricatures to provoke cross-chain collaboration (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/403636). After five caricatures have been published, I’m yet to understand how this will have any major impact in bringing the different blockchain communities closer together.

The impact is difficult to measure because it is likely that no mainstream media picks up the drawings to show to their audience (even if they did, the audience probably wouldn’t understand because they address mostly crypto enthusiasts who are ‘in the know’). Having said that, there’s always the possibility that one of the images goes viral and—hopefully—has the desired effect (and no unwanted backlash).

It would have been useful to include current numbers of the KPIs listed in the proposal, to see what the reach has been with the drawings created as part of the previous proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
Shlomo & Co have proven that they are able to deliver what they promise. It’s a good growing team that is getting stronger for Fund9. It is nice that the ideas are sourced from discussions with the community. You just need to be careful because images can be interpreted differently by different people. What is the message sent by an image* where Charles Hoskinson shields himself from an Ethereum arrow attack? Not quite sure.

(*) https://www.shlomocohen.com/galleries/CartoonAda/Shild.jpg
f6_assessments.q2: The team tracks social media views, retweets and media impressions. Community is kept up-to-date and consulted twice during the three-month period in after town hall sessions. Hence, it is fairly easy to keep tabs on the progress and success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: The aim of the proposal is to create caricatures that will be focused on fostering cross chain collaboration (caricatures designing different cryptocurrencies in a collaborative design). The proposer believe that art, caricatures and images could be one of ways how to create bridges between communities, as well as increase awareness and open-minded of crypto community. On one side, the idea makes sense and could be one of possible ways how to contribute to cross chain collaboration, on the other hand, I could not find any evidence supporting this idea. Are we able to measure the impact of such art with relation to cross-chain collaboration? How big impact it will cause? If we can not measure it, then how do we know it will be beneficial? Also, the problem statement that there is not enough creative ways that connect chains – also something I was not able to support with any information.
f6_assessments.q1: With respect to the feasibility, the roadmap is set to 12 weeks, with different activities planned such as brainstorming sessions, securing media channels, drawing cartoons and after-town hall meetings. The budget requested is 10 500 in total, and the breakdown is as follows: weekly cartoon for 500/piece/12 weeks, marketing & PR for 500/month and communication with media 1000/month. Regarding the team, there is currently 6 people, with their short bio provided and also linked in profiles. To assess the feasibility, I think it is feasible as it is, but some parts seems redundant, or too much, given the overall described plan, as well as some parts are unclear. 1. Brainstorming session with community – why, when there is already 6 people? Is there a logical reason why more people is needed? 2. One cartoon per week – who will do the drawing? If only one person, why do we need such many people in the team? 3. The amount per one drawing seems overstated – if there would be information how many hours are spend on one drawing, it could have been better for visualization.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs to monitor progress of the proposal are as follows: views on social media, posts, engagement of the community, a final report, and recorded after town hall sessions. I would definitely appreciate a link to twitter/telegram or discord, where some periodical updates could be posted. Nevertheless, the progress can be tracked, by caricatures itself, records, posts. Regarding the success, the proposer state that “inspired communities” would be the goal. But how would we measure it?  Another metric is – media sharing these caricatures or getting to mainstream media (these two metrics would evaluate the adaptation and popularity of caricatures, which is not the goal of this proposal). I think that given the problem – solution, which is to create caricatures and foster cross-chain collaboration, we are not really able to audit, whether the proposal was successful.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal somewhat addresses the challenge. However, while I am supportive of the idea on principle, I think a better case needs to be made as to how/why these caricatures will support cross chain collaboration. From what is included in the proposal we can infer that the artist believes these caricatures will not only showcase the importance of collaboration and cross-chain dependence, they will also serve an education purposes. 

What leaves me wondering about the impact is exactly how they will achieve these goals. I would have liked to see more details on the expected outcomes. What is it about the caricatures that will make people understand the necessity for interoperability? 

The proposer mentions that caricatures are a "Creative way to present the importance of cross chain could lead to higher awareness and openmind between blockchain communities" but there is no real way to know what affect this would have on cross collaboration. 

Given that the idea is fun and may bring a fun air to the community I am giving it 3/5. To receive higher marks there needs to be a more tangible/measurable impact for the community. Another thing that could help increase the score on impact would be to explain how groups beyond Cardano (the other side of interoperability) would participate in the identification and selection of characters/scenes to caricature.
f6_assessments.q1:
Yes, given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.  While I am still not sure about the level of impact this project may have, it is clear from the plan presented that the team is more than capable to deliver, should the be funded. 

The artist provides a very good background on their ability, including their own NFT project they have on Cardano already. The level of the artistic ability is very high and makes it extremely likely that the artist would be able to create excellent caricatures. The rest of the team members are also well described and provide confidence that they could deliver this project. 

The budget and timeline seems reasonable since it's primarily focused on developing the caricatures and using the team's experience to get them into the broader community. What I personally would have liked to see are more details on the plans to use social media to get the caricatures out into the community. If the plan is to get over 1M impressions, and hundreds of shares on social media, there could have been more explanation on how you plan to do this and within what timeframe.
f6_assessments.q2:
Yes, the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. 

This proposal is very straight forward with the team committing to develop twelve caricatures to support cross-chain collaboration. In addition to the actual caricatures being created and shared, the team will create a list of a media network through which their art will be displayed, track the # of views through this network, and then provide a final report to the community. 

A strength of the approach of this proposal is that they will use existing venues (After Town Hall) to canvass the community for input on specific caricatures. This will allow numerous opportunities for the community to speak up and guide the project. 

The proposers could have done a bit better job at explaining how the caricatures would inspire communities to build bridges. There doesn't seem to be a measure for how this could be tracked or a threshold for how the community would/could know whether it's been achieved.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement directly calls out a problem involving a lack of creativity in connecting communities. The proposal seeks to add very creatively to culture and build something unique for us all to enjoy but also learn from. As an artist, I know the power a simple work of creativity can have on changing minds; it is a very challenge-connected proposal for this reason.

The positive impact of reading the solution is that the proposal seeks to use artistic dialogue to build awareness of Cardano and promote an understanding of a multi-chain future. This concept adds to the culture of moving past small-mindedness and genuinely seeing the possibilities of working with several chains simultaneously. If the proposer is rewriting, perhaps they will consider adding thoughts about other blockchains into the solution area in writing. The two images are great examples of this and show voters precisely what type of work to expect.

The KPIs match the Challenge in that they focus on cross-chain connections and collaborations. This type of promotion of the spirit of the Challenge is quite valuable in that others will no doubt be inspired. Voters will see this unique value and likely be pleased with this section's clarity, vision, and weight. Bravo.

It seems there is a great potential to scale in that the proposer already has a successful NFT project and seeks to do more in the future.

After reading the mitigation tactics, the risks mentioned are both reasonable and appear to be manageable. There is a history of experience on the team and a deep understanding of the ideation process that helps produce new ideas. They also seek to involve the community in their brainstorming, which is an opportunity unlike any I've seen in Cardano so far; it says that the proposers also have trust in the community.

If rewriting, it may be valuable to use distribution as a risk and offer mitigations.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is clear which paid elements are part of the proposal. If rewriting, please add more detailed breakdowns (hourly rates, prices for each area). It will assist other artists and meet the new Fund 9 requirements around budget transparency.

The personnel section is outstanding. Complete bios stick to relevant history (thank you for respecting the voter's time!).

The plan includes a detailed roadmap and deliverables & KPIs together. Voters will benefit from the well-ordered list that carefully mentions each step along the road of carrying out the work. If rewriting, the proposer might tweak the visual appearance of the list to include dates and timelines to this roadmap as headings instead of parenthetically having them into the points. That said, what is provided is sufficient for success. The timetable is realistic for creating the 12 works; the experience of the artists attests to this.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap is straightforward and offers clear milestones. Voters may appreciate a more "phase 1:, phase 2:, etc." approach to the roadmap to visually break it up into steps. The time horizon is in the team's capacity, the artist has worked at this pace in the past, and the rest of the to-dos for other team members are undoubtedly reasonable (marketing, socials, etc.).

The KPIs regarding media and another about distribution to people of other blockchains are a bit unclear. The rest are straightforward, and only those two could use rewriting if submitted again.

The community can track with the offered hashtag, as well as through the artist's social media accounts. If rewriting, adding a Gitbook where weekly analytics could be tracked publicly would strengthen your auditability. These rationale explain the 4 star score.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks funding for a weekly caricature (for 12 weeks) showing the importance of collaborations and dependency between chains.
Problem is not clearly explained but it is understandable, not enough creative ways to show the connection between different chains.
This proposal is clearly in line with the challenge by targeting the awareness for the connection between different blockchains. 
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer present caricatures of his making that seem very pleasing and professional in my opinion. It is worth noting, that many blockchains are presented in a clever way in his work.
The proposer also will advertise the caricatures and will evaluate the building of an NFT model.
The plan of the proposal is clear and concise but detailed at the same time. The plan includes KPIs and deliverables.
The budget is clear and sufficiently detailed. The only thing is that it does not esplain the reasoning for the budget as it is suggested in the PAs Guide.
Cardano4climate, Cardanotress and Sustainable ADA will support the team and will facilitate connections and network as needed.
The ream is presented very well and has linkedin accounts for further research.
This proposer has submitted 7 proposals in fund 9 for total funding of $59200.
I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
With weekly cartoons presented the auditability of that project will be very easy. The proposer on top of that suggests to measure the public engagement in the media and other KPIs. 
The channel for communication will obviously be every media possible. 
Success metrics are well defined. 
Overall I do not foresee any problems to easily audit the progress of this project.
I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem raised by the author here is that there are not enough creative ways to connect chains and merge them to develop mass adoption. The author proposed the idea of ​​creating a weekly caricature showing the importance of cooperation and interdependence between chains, and educating other Blockchains. The proposal impacts the challenge and is detailed and richly described. Charles Hoskinson often chats with the community through youtube videos, to inspire, share his vision and the Cardano ecosystem. The author started with the creation of the NFT project hoskintoons.com, using his expertise to promote Cardano, through the Cross-Chain Collaboration challenge. A caricature will be created weekly. With the goal: connection and collaboration between Cardano and other blockchains in six months; approach, close many gaps,... Besides, the author realizes that there are not any major challenges with the project. The first challenge is: An important challenge could be setting up the plot. Another challenge: how to generate revenue. Along with those challenges, the author has prepared solutions to ensure the project is carried out successfully
f6_assessments.q1: The author provides us with the necessary information to evaluate this section. The first is about the roadmap, the author has provided information about the work to be done during the week. Include CrossChain collaborative work (by Cardano) in the website; Get help from the Catalyst.v.v community. One positive thing is that the author has provided KPIs in this section, which shows that the author is well prepared, knows what he is going to do, how to achieve it. to the result. Next is the budget. Proposal asks for $10,500. In my opinion, this is a fairly low budget requirement given the complex work on the project (Cartoon Weekly). In addition, the author also provides specific amounts of funds that will be clearly allocated. We know how the funding will be used, for what purposes. Finally, about the team members participating in the group. We know the members are all people with the right skills and experience to do the work on the project. At the same time, the author also provides texts presentation about each member, and attaches links to let us know more about the history and experience of the members that the proposal has presented. In general, the plan of the proposal is very good, the budget is transparent and the members are skilled and experienced, increasing the feasibility of the proposal. Proposal is highly feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The author of the proposal provides us with indicators so that we can easily check project progress. Social media views (likes on twitter, RT...); posts using tags; Weekly Cartune; final report and ppt, sessions after town hall will be recorded... We have many indicators, and many ways to measure progress. In my opinion, the information is necessary and satisfactory has been established, we know the goals we expect, and the benefits to the community and the ecosystem. About the final product is the success of the project, which is expected. Inspiring the community, building a bridge between the communities; Sharing and reaching out about Caricature media on community media channels.

f6_assessments.q0: I find promoting cross-chain collaboration via properly though caricatures as very interesting idea that can increase general knowledge of cross-chain interconnectedness, serve as first step for projects to consider building or transferring their project to Cardano. As artistic content is easy to share, has possibility to expand through many medias, reach of well though caricature is enormous. Therefore, this proposal fits challenge setting to bring awareness & understanding while creating friendly culture between chains. This project can scale well within this challenge, a lot of different topics need to be covered and a lot of caricatures can be done here. An idea brought by proposal team to use NFTs of caricatures to generate income for additional contribution is great way to have income so that project can be further sustained and deliver more content to chain collaboration.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has clearly defined parts and for each part a team member is set. Team is fully qualified to job according to posted LinkedIn accounts and it has well-known professional artist Shlomo Cohen for most important part of project – caricatures creation. The budget is divided into 3 main parts, but it misses specifics for marketing and communication part, where more detailed explanation of costs would help clarify usage of funds. It is unclear how much is hourly rate of team members, how much for website will be used because team already has website for caricatures so only new page is needed. Timetable is well set with tasks split for caricature publishing on weekly basis with some preparation period. In proposal is missing additional information for technologies to be used to achieve and spread caricatures, what social media site will be used or what blockchain community media channels will be used. Challenges and risks are considered. Overall, proposal has enough information to be classified as feasible, even with shortcomings noted in assessment.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposal completion can be audited by community thanks to good timetable split on weekly basis. Main KPI is set to pass million impressions with hundreds of shares on social network. As suggested by proposal team, custom hashtag will be used to track reach of caricatures, which is well though way to track reach. Additionally for higher reach use of media & community channels is good idea to boost posts on release. As proposed, final report should contain data for mentioned KPIs. Proposal defined challenge problem as generally as increasing awareness of cross-chain collaboration which would in turn help collaboration. Solution via caricatures for this problem is efficient and sufficient.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is about connecting chains together and expanding mass adoption,
In this proposal proposal has a unique idea which is creating caricature showing the importance of collaborations and dependency between chains for mass market adoption, By this way the importance of cross chain could lead to higher awareness and openmind between blockchain communities.The proposal clearly adds the value to the cardano eco system and The key metrices and the goals of the proposal align with the outlined challenge settings. The proposal have also mentioned the risks and challenges and also mentioned the solution to tackle the risks.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer have provided a detailed plan, including timeline and key milestones for implementing the project .In which it includes the sessions with the community and preparation of media channels and sharing cartoons . The Timeline provided is very realistic. Some work in budget section is needed , More elaborative budget breakdown would have been better. But the idea to promote cardano is great .The proposer have provided a detailed information about the team .
The links of their works , Experience  and skills needed  to implement the proposal is described .upon reviewing the proposal I agree that the proposal is likely to be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The progress of the proposal can be measured by looking at number views on social media , number of hashtags used and the proposer will submit the final report and the ppt to the community .The proposer have provided the clear understandable description of the challenge and The approach for the successful implementation is described. The Metrices/Kip's mentioned in the proposal define the success of the proposal.  The proposer have submitted enough details to review the proposal .

solution: A weekly caricature showing the importance of collaborations and dependency between chains for mass market adoption, and that also have educational purposes for other Blockchains
experience:
40 years of experience making daily political cartoons for newspapers, in the largest/most read newspaper in Israel (Israel Hayom) , won multiple awards, NFT designer
Funded proposer for Fund 8 on similar proposals :
CARICATOR ADA 
United Caricature
